title: match of associated_const from const_fn

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
I am using an associated constant in a match pattern. The associated constant was initiated with a const function. https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=0a3ce02daba0b2226cac&version=nightly

``` rust
#![feature(associated_consts, const_fn)]
struct A(u32);

impl A {
    const fn new() -> A { A(0) }
    const TEST: A = A::new();
}

fn main() {
    match A(1) {
        A::TEST => (),
        _ => ()
    }
}
```

I would expect this to work but instead I get a compile error.

Version:
rustc 1.3.0-nightly (4d52d7c85 2015-07-30)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4d52d7c85703fdf41eefb852afac140938cf2a64

host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.3.0-nightly
